paper_abstract: The general Randic index R-alpha(G) of a graph G is defined as the sum of the weights (d(u)d(v))(alpha) of all edges uv of G, where d(u) denotes the degree of a vertex u in G. In this paper, we consider bicyclic graphs with n vertices and give the structure of graphs with minimum general Randic index for alpha <= -2.
paper_title: Bicyclic graphs with minimum general Randic index
